name: Holiday Inn Southaven - Central

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and each time the stay has gotten worse. First off....the location away from the interstate and main roads is nice but they fail to tell you that you are right in line with Memphis International so the Fed Ex planes are coming in one after the other late at night which makes sleep difficult. Secondly..each time I've stayed I had to call down for a blanket,alarm clock,etc...each time was in the evening and it took a good while to get these items. The last time I had to go down to the desk after a period of long waiting for a blanket fo find what looked like to be a manager texting on her phone and said "oh sorry I was about to bring your blanket". I'm a platinum member and asked for an upgrade this last time and the female desk clerk said there are none available at this time but yet the parking lot was empty. Come to think of it the parking lot has been empty each time I've stayed. Guess that should have told me. Overal it's a nice hotel as far as the layout and design but between the planes all night long and the general careless attitude of the front desk I will not go back and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: not so great of a hotel

reviews.text: Don't count on sleeping during the week as a steady stream of Fed Ex jets land constantly from 10-12 pm and begin taking off in equal numbers at 4 am. Unlike locations by other airports where passenger service rarely comes in after 10 pm or departs before 6 am, this was like sleeping on the tarmac! There is no "satisfaction guarantee" or your money back at this location! If you book here, bring your Bose ear phones to block the "thunder."
reviews.title: located under FED EX flight pattern

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel four (4) nights a week for the past five(5) months. The staff here is great. This is truly my home away from home. The food in the restaurant is great. The room is cozy and the bed feels like my bed at home. Anything you need is just a quick phone call away. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: loved the staff

reviews.text: The rooms were okay and even though I am a Platinum Member and the motel appeared to be on the empty side no priority upgrades were available. Hmmmm? Maybe too difficult to check into.
reviews.title: Not terrible, but........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ate dinner and breakfast at the motel and for dinner the catfish was edible but barely. It was overcooked and heavily breaded and very salty. I received a flat soft drink to accompany the meal.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Inn

reviews.text: Located in an area of light industrial businesses and distribution centers, the Holiday Inn Memphis-Southaven may not be the best place for those seeking fast access to the Beale Street entertainment district. But for someone like me, who was just passing through and seeking a location close to the highway--with lots of restaurant options and free parking--this place more than fit the bill. And the sights of Memphis are only 15 minutes or so away.
reviews.title: Several notches above the surrounding hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This particular Holiday Inn is one of a new generation of hotels, with flat-screen, high-definition TVs, high-quality bath products, great beds and a modern look throughout. It is a great value when compared with 90's-era, tired-looking Hamptons and Courtyards.
reviews.title: Very nice, courteous, and attentive staff

reviews.text: I definitely heard the air traffic, but it wasn't loud enough to keep me awake. I can't comment about the poor reviews of the restaurant since I didn't try it, but there are a bunch of other places close by.
reviews.title: Great new hotel

reviews.text: My final comment is that, though it's a brand-new hotel, it was built on the cheap, as many of these pre-fab buildings are. Things are already starting to come apart (e.g. the shower walls). But as long as the management keeps up with the maintenance, it should remain a good option for this part of the Memphis area.
reviews.title: Very attractive contemporary Holiday Inn

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, clean, well maintained and the few times that I had a problem, they were handled at once.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.text: This is a great example of Holiday Inn's new prototype building - rooms are bright, stylish and modern, with flat screen TVs (although at 27" they're sized too small for the generous room size). I stayed on points and received a corner room that has a small wraparaound window setup, but I don't think the corner/end rooms are bigger than standard rooms.
reviews.title: Beautiful new Holiday Inn design; a few caveats

reviews.text: A big plus is that this is a full service hotel...with included high speed internet. It's wired in the rooms with only a weaker wifi signal available. The wired access was fast.
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay while in Memphis

reviews.text: One "wrinkle the nose" issue is the bathrooms. While the sink/vanity area is granite and looks modern, the shower-only setup in my king room looked like a throwback to 1985 - with cheesy beige ceramic tile on the walls and small floor tile borrowed from a high school locker room. It's as if the owners ran out of money while building the property.
reviews.title: Very impressive for a Holiday Inn
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Now, for the noise issue: It's true that this hotel is beneath the takeoff/landing approach for the north/south runways at MEM. At my mid-level room, the corner wraparound window probably intensified the rumblings from the FedEx DC-10s taking off to the south; my north-facing room probably wasn't best either. If you do stay, ask for a lower level and south-facing room, and NOT a corner room,and I believe you'll be in great shape.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also keep in mind that this property, while new and fresh, is by itself in its area - there are no restaurants within walking distance; indeed, there is little but empty lots within walking distance. It's a very short drive to Goodman Road and many dining options, however.
reviews.title: Definitely Worth Staying the Night

reviews.text: This is a very new hotel located very close to I-55 and within a very short drive to a busy shopping/restaurant area. Everything was very modern, new and clean.
reviews.title: Could be Better

reviews.text: We had issues with check-in as did other family members who were staying here for a wedding. We arrived at 5 minutes to 3PM (which was check-in time) and no rooms were ready. The clerk even commented that it wasn't check in time yet, as if all the rooms were suddenly going to be cleaned in the next 5 minutes. My sister-in-law attempted to check in 3 times that day. (This was not a huge wedding, maybe a half dozen rooms). When she was finally allowed to check in (on the 3rd try) my sister-in-law was sent to one room, which was not ready, then to another, which was not ready and finally to a third room. (Of course she doesn't find out it isn't ready until she has lugged all her luggage and 2 kids to the room). We all finally settled in by 4PM. I saw other guests later arguing with the front desk about rooms not being ready. Then there was a typo in my name on the reservation (made by phone) and there was quite the run around to confirm that yes, it was really me. All this may have been a one time issue or a particular clerk.
reviews.title: Service was Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My major disappointment was that unlike other hotels of this category there was no breakfast. There is a restaurant on site, however I would note that it was closed when we arrived in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Great room...not so great service

reviews.text: If the service improves and you're not bothered by the lack of breakfast this would be a fine hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: New, fresh and trendy (trendy for Southhaven, MS that is)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I needed to know where the closest Bank of America was and not only did one of the wait staff look it up but brought the information to the room for me! Service like that is rare. I believe her name was Cheryl. The Wait staff at my breakfast were so friendly it set the tone for my day. All I can say is WOW and Thank you!
reviews.title: Clean hotel, poor bath facilities

aka: Holiday Inn Southaven - Central Hotel Southaven
description: The property is just minutes off I-55 at exit 289. Located just one block off of Goodman Road in one of the most thriving areas of Southaven. We are just 15 minutes from downtown Memphis for all the area attractions or the Memphis International Airport. Quiet location with clean comfortable accommodations. All rooms have a microwave, refrigerator, coffee service, HD TV and complimentary internet service that are fast and reliable. We have a restaurant and lounge on site, indoor pool, two outdoor patios, and lots of parking. No fees for parking. Parking lot can accommodate large vehicles. Our friendly staff is waiting to greet you.
